actions.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.
Reported by the Committee on Transportation. H. Rept. 106-60.
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 26.
Mr. Coble moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H. Con. Res. 48.
On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and referred to the Committee on Rules and Administration.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Economic Development, Public Buildings, Hazardous Materials and Pipeline Transportation

official_title: Authorizing the use of the Capitol Grounds for the opening ceremonies of Sunrayce 99.

summary.text: Permits the organizers of Sunrayce 99 to sponsor a free public event with solar-powered cars, for the opening ceremonies for Sunrayce 99, on the Capitol grounds on June 20, 1999.

titles.title: Authorizing the use of the Capitol Grounds for the opening ceremonies of Sunrayce 99.
